Package dnl.node

Class Sink

  • java.lang.Object
    • dnl.node.Node
      • dnl.node.Sink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    public class Sink
extends Node
    This class models behavior at a sink (at a destination node): all vehicles reaching the sink are removed from the network.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Node
        Resets this Node to start a new dynamic network loading
        Specified by:

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: Node
        This is called every time step. For the Node class, Node.step() should move flow between incoming and outgoing Links.
        Specified by:
        step in class Node

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from class: Node
        This is called every time step, after Node.step() has been called for all Nodes and Links. It can be used to finish any updating work that could not occur during Node.step(). DO NOT use this to update the internal state of Links. This is used to update the state of this Node.
        Specified by:
        update in class Node

      • getNumExiting

        public double getNumExiting()

      • storeTurningProportion

        public void storeTurningProportion​(Link i,
                                   Link j,
                                   double p)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Used when constructing the Node: adjusts the turning proportion from Link i to Link j. Turning proportions must add to 1 for all incoming Links.
        Overrides:
        storeTurningProportion in class Node

      • getTurningProp

        public double getTurningProp​(Link i,
                             Link j)
        Overrides:
        getTurningProp in class Node
        Returns:
        the proportion of flow leaving Link i turning onto Link j. The value is between 0 and 1.
